metadata.title: CVE-2017-9260 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The TDStretchSSE::calcCrossCorr function insource/SoundTouch/sse_optimized.cpp in SoundTouch 1.9.2 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read andapplication crash) via a crafted wav file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9260` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsoundtouch1 - 1.9.2-2+deb9u1build0.16.04.1
soundstretch - 1.9.2-2+deb9u1build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: soundtouch package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.2-2+deb9u1build0.16.04.1').
